intro: Erigeron sylvestris, commonly known as woodland fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in well-drained soil. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Erigeron sylvestris is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
